intro: Spicanta attenuata, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with thin, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often with a waxy coating. Spicanta attenuata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
